private_information: I want to spend exactly 6 days in Krakow
Krakow has a direct flight connection with Zurich only
krakow_planner.goal: Contribute scheduling constraints so that Krakow is allocated exactly 6 days within the 16-day trip and travel respects direct-flight connectivity.

private_information: I want to spend exactly 7 days in Athens
I will visit relatives in Athens between day 1 and day 7 inclusive
Athens has a direct flight connection with Zurich only
athens_planner.goal: Contribute scheduling constraints so that Athens is allocated exactly 7 days within the 16-day trip and the Athens visit window [day 1..day 7] is respected and travel respects direct-flight connectivity.

private_information: I want to spend exactly 5 days in Zurich
Zurich has direct flight connections with Krakow and Athens
zurich_planner.goal: Contribute scheduling constraints so that Zurich is allocated exactly 5 days within the 16-day trip and travel respects direct-flight connectivity.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the planners' constraints and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards planner that schedules the 16-day trip using only direct flights and satisfying all city-specific constraints.

public_information: The trip lasts 16 days in total
You visit exactly these three cities: Krakow, Athens, Zurich
Only direct flights may be used to commute between cities
Direct flight connections exist between Zurich and Krakow and between Athens and Zurich
There is no direct flight between Athens and Krakow

spec.system_prompt: You are a local city planner module for Krakow. Provide structured local scheduling facts and hard constraints that reflect your private information and what you require for the global trip plan. Do not emit PDDL. Represent the facts in a concise, unambiguous textual form that an orchestrator can consume.
spec.prompt: You are krakow_planner. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->krakow_planner->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->krakow_planner->goal}. Provide the facts and constraints you require for the trip as a small structured list such as allocation days required, allowed travel adjacency constraints, and any immovable requirements.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator that must integrate local planners' structured constraints and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem tailored for the FastDownwards planner. You must keep actions for different agents distinct and encode travel adjacency constraints based on direct flights. You must enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards planner in your modeling choices.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive structured constraints from each city planner: {pddl_orchestrator->input}. Your goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the constraints into a single multi-agent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models days 1..16, assigns contiguous day allocations for each city equal to their requested lengths (Krakow 6 days, Athens 7 days, Zurich 5 days), enforces the Athens visit window between day 1 and day 7 inclusive, and allows transitions between cities only along direct flights (Zurich-Krakow, Athens-Zurich). Keep actions for city stays and travel distinct per agent where appropriate. Provide the PDDL domain enclosed in <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem enclosed in <problem></problem>. Ensure the PDDL is suitable for FastDownwards.
